title: Fan, 1820–30
description: Brisé fan. Sticks of incised and drilled bone decorated with metallic foil and polished steel spangles; silk connecting ribbon; mother-of-pearl washer at the rivet. Originally, lenses were set into the circular openings at the ends of the two guards of this arrow-shaped fan, known as an opera glass or lognette fan. In a closed position the fan functions as a small spy-glass.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fan, 1820–30.
1820–30. Gift of Sarah Cooper Hewitt. 1931-66-26.
